sentences: Ma olen all oma ema ees.
Ta on alati all oma isa nõuanded.
context: In Estonian, 'all' is an adverb and preposition that means 'under', 'below', or 'submissive to'. It indicates position beneath something else or being under someone's authority. When used as a preposition, it typically takes the partitive case. In some contexts, it can also indicate submission to someone's will or authority.
